Root Canal Treatment - posterior.name: Root Canal Treatment - posterior
Root Canal Treatment - posterior.description: A dental procedure to remove infected pulp from the back teeth, filling the root canal, and sealing the tooth to alleviate pain and save it from extraction.

Root Canal Treatment - anterior.name: Root Canal Treatment - anterior
Root Canal Treatment - anterior.description: Similar to posterior RCT, but performed on front teeth, preserving their natural appearance and functionality.

Whitening.name: Whitening
Whitening.description: A cosmetic treatment to lighten teeth, removing stains and discoloration, providing a brighter smile.

Single sitting RCT- Anterior.name: Single sitting RCT- Anterior
Single sitting RCT- Anterior.description: Root canal treatment completed in one visit, saving time and reducing discomfort for patients with infected front teeth.

Single sitting RCT- Posterior.name: Single sitting RCT- Posterior
Single sitting RCT- Posterior.description: Root canal treatment completed in one visit, saving time and reducing discomfort for patients with infected back teeth.

Root canal treatment- anterior- BDS.name: Root canal treatment- anterior- BDS
Root canal treatment- anterior- BDS.description: An anterior RCT performed by a dentist, treating infected front teeth to maintain oral health.

Consultation.name: Consultation
Consultation.description: An appointment with a dental professional to discuss oral health issues, receive advice, and plan necessary treatments.

Root canal treatment- posterior- BDS.name: Root canal treatment- posterior- BDS
Root canal treatment- posterior- BDS.description: An anterior RCT performed by a dentist, treating infected back teeth to maintain oral health.

Re-Root canal treatment- anterior.name: Re-Root canal treatment- anterior
Re-Root canal treatment- anterior.description: A repeat of the root canal procedure, typically done to treat persistently infected front teeth.

Re-Root canal treatment- Posterior.name: Re-Root canal treatment- Posterior
Re-Root canal treatment- Posterior.description: A repeat of the root canal procedure, typically done to treat persistently infected back teeth.

Composite Laminates- per teeth.name: Composite Laminates- per teeth
Composite Laminates- per teeth.description: Thin resin shells bonded to the teeth to improve aesthetics, correct minor imperfections, and enhance smiles.

Indirect Veneers - per teeth.name: Indirect  Veneers - per teeth
Indirect Veneers - per teeth.description: Custom-made porcelain or ceramic veneers to cover the front surface of teeth for a natural and durable appearance.

Post and Core(fibre) for post plus RCT C.name: Post and Core(fibre) for post plus RCT Charges (Add on)
Post and Core(fibre) for post plus RCT C.description: A custom-made post inserted into the root canal with fiber material, providing support for a dental crown after root canal treatment.

Dental jewellery.name: Dental jewellery
Dental jewellery.description: Non-invasive cosmetic application of jewels on teeth to enhance appearance.

Internal bleaching (Add on).name: Internal bleaching (Add on)
Internal bleaching (Add on).description: A procedure to whiten a discolored tooth from within, often performed after a root canal treatment.

Apicoectomy (Add on).name: Apicoectomy (Add on)
Apicoectomy (Add on).description: A surgical procedure to remove the tip of the tooth root and infected tissue around it to save a severely damaged tooth.

Topical fluoride application- Adult (per.name: Topical fluoride application- Adult (per teeth)
Topical fluoride application- Adult (per.description: Application of fluoride on adult teeth to strengthen enamel and prevent decay.

X-Ray.name: X-Ray
X-Ray.description: Diagnostic imaging to visualize teeth, bones, and surrounding structures, aiding in identifying dental problems.

Composite Filling- single surface.name: Composite Filling- single surface
Composite Filling- single surface.description: A tooth-colored resin filling used to restore and strengthen teeth affected by decay or damage.

Composite Filling-Two surfaces.name: Composite Filling-Two surfaces
Composite Filling-Two surfaces.description: A tooth-colored resin filling used to restore and strengthen teeth affected by decay or damage.

GIC filling-single surface.name: GIC filling-single surface
GIC filling-single surface.description: Glass ionomer cement filling used to repair teeth with decay or minor damage.

GIC filling- two surface.name: GIC filling- two surface
GIC filling- two surface.description: Glass ionomer cement filling used to repair teeth with decay or minor damage.

Pit and fissure sealants /tooth (per too.name: Pit and fissure sealants /tooth (per tooth)
Pit and fissure sealants /tooth (per too.description: Protective coating applied to the chewing surfaces of molars and premolars to prevent cavities.

Oral prohylaxis- single sitting.name: Oral prohylaxis- single sitting
Oral prohylaxis- single sitting.description: Dental cleaning and scaling procedure to remove plaque, tartar, and stains, promoting oral health in one visit

Oral prohylaxis-Two sittings.name: Oral prohylaxis-Two sittings
Oral prohylaxis-Two sittings.description: Dental cleaning and scaling procedure to remove plaque, tartar, and stains, promoting oral health in two visits

Consultation with specialist.name: Consultation with specialist
Consultation with specialist.description: An appointment with a specialized dental professional to address complex oral issues and discuss treatment options.

Dental Implant- Basic.name: Dental Implant- Basic
Dental Implant- Basic.description: Surgical insertion of an artificial tooth root into the jawbone to support a dental crown.

Implant crown- PFM- Screw retained.name: Implant crown- PFM- Screw retained
Implant crown- PFM- Screw retained.description: A porcelain-fused-to-metal dental crown attached to an implant via a screw.

Implant crown- PFM- Cement retained.name: Implant crown- PFM- Cement retained
Implant crown- PFM- Cement retained.description: A porcelain-fused-to-metal dental crown attached to an implant via cement.

Implant crown- Zirconia- Screw retained.name: Implant crown- Zirconia- Screw retained
Implant crown- Zirconia- Screw retained.description: A Zirconia dental crown attached to an implant with a screw for enhanced aesthetics.

Implant crown- Zirconia- Cement retained.name: Implant crown- Zirconia- Cement retained
Implant crown- Zirconia- Cement retained.description: A Zirconia dental crown attached to an implant with cement for enhanced aesthetics.

All on 6 implant - implant+ prosthesis.name: All on 6 implant - implant+ prosthesis
All on 6 implant - implant+ prosthesis.description: A full arch dental restoration supported by six implants to replace missing teeth.

All on 4 implant - implant+ prosthesis.name: All on 4 implant - implant+ prosthesis
All on 4 implant - implant+ prosthesis.description: A full arch dental restoration supported by four implants to replace missing teeth.

Temporary crown.name: Temporary crown
Temporary crown.description: A provisional crown placed over a prepared tooth while the permanent crown is being fabricated.

Implant supported overdentures.name: Implant supported overdentures
Implant supported overdentures.description: Dentures attached to dental implants for improved stability and function.

Metallic Braces.name: Metallic Braces
Metallic Braces.description: Orthodontic devices to align teeth using metallic material for durability

Ceramic Braces.name: Ceramic Braces
Ceramic Braces.description: Orthodontic devices to align teeth using ceramic material for aesthetics

Imported Self Ligature Braces-Ceramic.name: Imported Self Ligature Braces-Ceramic
Imported Self Ligature Braces-Ceramic.description: Imported advanced braces with self-ligating brackets for efficient tooth movement.

Self Ligature Braces-Metal.name: Self Ligature Braces-Metal
Self Ligature Braces-Metal.description: Advanced braces with self-ligating brackets for efficient tooth movement.

Smiles.ai Aligners Variant A (Aligner Si.name: Smiles.ai Aligners Variant A (Aligner Simple)
Smiles.ai Aligners Variant A (Aligner Si.description: Custom clear aligners for gradual teeth straightening of simple cases.

Smiles.ai Aligners Variant B (Aligner Co.name: Smiles.ai Aligners Variant B (Aligner Complex)
Smiles.ai Aligners Variant B (Aligner Co.description: Custom clear aligners for gradual teeth straightening of complex cases.

Smiles.ai Aligners Hybrid.name: Smiles.ai Aligners Hybrid
Smiles.ai Aligners Hybrid.description: Custom clear aligners for gradual teeth straightening in combination with braces.

Habit Breaking Appliance (starts from).name: Habit Breaking Appliance (starts from)
Habit Breaking Appliance (starts from).description: Dental devices used to correct harmful oral habits in children.

Orthopedic /Myofunctional appliances.name: Orthopedic /Myofunctional appliances
Orthopedic /Myofunctional appliances.description: Devices to guide jaw growth and correct jaw-related issues.

Fixed retainer.name: Fixed retainer
Fixed retainer.description: Fixed dental appliance used for teeth alignment and bite correction.

Removable appliances.name: Removable appliances
Removable appliances.description: Removable dental appliance used for teeth alignment and bite correction.

Expander- removable/Fixed.name: Expander- removable/Fixed
Expander- removable/Fixed.description: An expander is a dental appliance used to widen the upper jaw and correct issues related to narrow dental arches and misalignment.

Essix retainer.name: Essix retainer
Essix retainer.description: Transparent, removable retainers used to maintain teeth position after orthodontic treatment.

TADs.name: TADs
TADs.description: Temporary Anchorage Devices used to provide stable anchor points for tooth movement during orthodontic treatment.

Fixed functional appliance.name: Fixed functional appliance
Fixed functional appliance.description: A dental device used to correct jaw discrepancies and promote proper bite alignment by applying gentle pressure on the teeth and jaw.

Sleep apnoe devise- ASD.name: Sleep apnoe devise- ASD
Sleep apnoe devise- ASD.description: An appliance designed to treat sleep apnea by advancing the lower jaw, which helps keep the airway open during sleep, preventing interruptions in breathing.

Deprogramming splint - TMD.name: Deprogramming splint - TMD
Deprogramming splint - TMD.description: A custom-made oral device used to relax the jaw muscles and alleviate temporomandibular joint disorder (TMD) symptoms by preventing teeth contact during jaw movement.

Topical Fluoride Application (per tooth).name: Topical Fluoride Application (per tooth)
Topical Fluoride Application (per tooth).description: A procedure where fluoride is applied to the individual tooth surface to strengthen enamel, prevent tooth decay, and reduce sensitivity.

Composite Filling kids (Paediatric patie.name: Composite Filling kids (Paediatric patients)
Composite Filling kids (Paediatric patie.description: A tooth-colored filling material used to repair cavities in children's teeth, blending with the natural tooth color for a more aesthetic result.

Root Canal Treatment Kids (Paediatric pa.name: Root Canal Treatment Kids (Paediatric patients)
Root Canal Treatment Kids (Paediatric pa.description: A dental procedure performed on children's teeth to remove infected pulp, clean the root canal, and seal it to save a severely decayed or injured tooth.

Extraction- Mobile tooth.name: Extraction- Mobile tooth
Extraction- Mobile tooth.description: The removal of a loose or mobile tooth that cannot be saved due to advanced periodontal disease or trauma.

Extraction- decayed/serial extraction.name: Extraction- decayed/serial extraction
Extraction- decayed/serial extraction.description: The removal of a severely decayed tooth or a planned extraction of specific teeth as part of a treatment plan, typically for orthodontic purposes.

Pedo crowns- metal.name: Pedo crowns- metal
Pedo crowns- metal.description: Metal crowns used for children's primary teeth to restore severely damaged or decayed teeth.

Pedo crowns- Zirconia.name: Pedo crowns- Zirconia
Pedo crowns- Zirconia.description: Zirconia crowns used for children's primary teeth as a durable and aesthetic alternative to metal crowns.

Space maintainer.name: Space maintainer
Space maintainer.description: A dental device used to hold space for a permanent tooth when a primary tooth is lost prematurely, preventing neighboring teeth from shifting.

Pulpectomy.name: Pulpectomy
Pulpectomy.description: A root canal treatment for primary (baby) teeth, removing infected pulp to relieve pain and prevent the spread of infection.

Re-implantation-tooth avulsion.name: Re-implantation-tooth avulsion
Re-implantation-tooth avulsion.description: The procedure of reinserting an avulsed (knocked-out) tooth back into its socket to attempt to save the tooth.

Sports splints- custom made.name: Sports splints- custom made
Sports splints- custom made.description: Customized mouthguards used during sports activities to protect teeth and reduce the risk of dental injuries.

Crown lengthening-manual(scalpel)- per t.name: Crown lengthening-manual(scalpel)- per tooth
Crown lengthening-manual(scalpel)- per t.description: A surgical procedure to expose more tooth structure by removing gum tissue and bone, often performed to prepare for crown placement.

Flap Surgery -Full mouth.name: Flap Surgery -Full mouth
Flap Surgery -Full mouth.description: A surgical procedure where gum tissue is lifted and bone reshaped to treat advanced gum disease affecting the entire mouth.

Flap Surgery -Per quadrant.name: Flap Surgery -Per quadrant
Flap Surgery -Per quadrant.description: A surgical procedure similar to full mouth flap surgery but performed on one quadrant (quarter) of the mouth at a time.

Bone Graft (DEPENDING ON THE GRAFT).name: Bone Graft (DEPENDING ON THE GRAFT)
Bone Graft (DEPENDING ON THE GRAFT).description: A procedure to augment bone volume using various bone graft materials, promoting implant success or enhancing bone health.

Bone Graft - Perioglass (0.50 cc).name: Bone Graft - Perioglass (0.50 cc)
Bone Graft - Perioglass (0.50 cc).description: A specific type and quantity of bone graft material (Perioglass) used to fill bone defects and stimulate new bone growth.

Bone Graft - Nova Bone Putty (0.25cc).name: Bone Graft - Nova Bone Putty (0.25cc)
Bone Graft - Nova Bone Putty (0.25cc).description: A specific type and quantity of bone graft material (Nova Bone Putty) used for bone regeneration and supporting implant placement.

Membrane (cologide).name: Membrane (cologide)
Membrane (cologide).description: A collagen-based membrane used in guided tissue regeneration to promote the growth of new bone and gum tissue during surgical procedures.

Curettage (per qudrant ).name: Curettage (per qudrant )
Curettage (per qudrant ).description: A deep cleaning procedure performed on one quadrant of the mouth to treat gum disease and remove infected tissue.

Splinting- 4 teeth.name: Splinting- 4 teeth
Splinting- 4 teeth.description: The stabilization of four teeth together using a splint to provide support and immobilization, usually after trauma or due to periodontal issues.

Crown - PFM 5yrs Warranty.name: Crown - PFM 5yrs Warranty
Crown - PFM 5yrs Warranty.description: A porcelain-fused-to-metal crown with a 5-year warranty, offering both strength and aesthetics.

Crown- DMLS 10yrs Warraty.name: Crown- DMLS 10yrs Warraty
Crown- DMLS 10yrs Warraty.description: A crown made using Direct Metal Laser Sintering technology, providing high durability and a 10-year warranty.

Crown- Zirconia 7 yrs.name: Crown- Zirconia 7 yrs
Crown- Zirconia 7 yrs.description: A Zirconia crown with a 7-year lifespan, offering excellent aesthetics and strength.

Crown- Premium Zirconia15 yrs.name: Crown- Premium Zirconia15 yrs
Crown- Premium Zirconia15 yrs.description: A premium Zirconia crown known for its superior strength and aesthetics, with a 15-year lifespan.

Complete Denture - Indian.name: Complete Denture - Indian
Complete Denture - Indian.description: A full set of dentures made using conventional techniques for patients with missing teeth.

Complete Denture - BPS.name: Complete Denture - BPS
Complete Denture - BPS.description: A complete denture fabricated using the Biofunctional Prosthetic System (BPS) technique, ensuring better fit and function.

Removable Partial Denture- upto 3 teeth.name: Removable Partial Denture- upto 3 teeth
Removable Partial Denture- upto 3 teeth.description: A removable prosthesis used to replace up to three missing teeth.

Removable Partial Denture- add on -Per t.name: Removable Partial Denture- add on -Per tooth
Removable Partial Denture- add on -Per t.description: Adding an additional artificial tooth to an existing removable partial denture.

Flexible Partial Denture- upto 3 teeth.name: Flexible Partial Denture- upto 3 teeth
Flexible Partial Denture- upto 3 teeth.description: A flexible and lightweight removable partial denture used to replace up to three missing teeth.

Flexible Partial Denture- add on per too.name: Flexible Partial Denture- add on per tooth
Flexible Partial Denture- add on per too.description: Adding a flexible artificial tooth to an existing flexible partial denture.

CAD CAM CPD- upto 3 teeth.name: CAD CAM CPD- upto 3 teeth
CAD CAM CPD- upto 3 teeth.description: A computer-aided design and manufacturing technique used to create a custom partial denture for up to three missing teeth.

CPD- add on per tooth.name: CPD- add on per tooth
CPD- add on per tooth.description: Adding a custom artificial tooth to an existing CAD CAM partial denture.

Metal crown.name: Metal crown
Metal crown.description: A crown made entirely of metal, often used for posterior teeth due to its durability.

Recementation.name: Recementation
Recementation.description: The process of reattaching a dental restoration, such as a crown or bridge, to the prepared tooth surface using dental cement.

Re-lining and rebasing.name: Re-lining and rebasing
Re-lining and rebasing.description: Adjusting the fit of a denture by adding new material to the fitting surface (re-lining) or creating an entirely new base (rebasing).

Crown removal.name: Crown removal
Crown removal.description: The careful removal of a dental crown to assess the underlying tooth or prepare for a new restoration.

Intra-oral scan.name: Intra-oral scan
Intra-oral scan.description: A digital scanning method used to create a three-dimensional model of the teeth and oral structures for various dental treatments.

Mock up- Lab.name: Mock up- Lab
Mock up- Lab.description: A replica or model of a proposed dental treatment plan created in the dental laboratory to visualize the final result before actual treatment.

Tooth Extraction - Firm.name: Tooth Extraction - Firm
Tooth Extraction - Firm.description: The extraction of a tooth with stable roots and surrounding bone.

Tooth Extraction - Mobile.name: Tooth Extraction - Mobile
Tooth Extraction - Mobile.description: The extraction of a tooth that has become loose due to gum disease or trauma.

Tooth Extraction - Root Stumps.name: Tooth Extraction - Root Stumps
Tooth Extraction - Root Stumps.description: The removal of the remaining root portion of a broken or decayed tooth that cannot be restored.

Tooth Extraction - Surgical.name: Tooth Extraction - Surgical
Tooth Extraction - Surgical.description: A more complex tooth extraction requiring a surgical approach, often necessary for impacted or severely damaged teeth.

3rd molar Extraction - Non surgical.name: 3rd molar Extraction - Non surgical
3rd molar Extraction - Non surgical.description: The removal of a third molar (wisdom tooth) without the need for surgical intervention.

3rd molar Disimpaction - Surgical.name: 3rd molar Disimpaction - Surgical
3rd molar Disimpaction - Surgical.description: A surgical procedure to remove an impacted third molar (wisdom tooth) that hasn't erupted properly.

3rd molar Disimpaction - Surgical- Disto.name: 3rd molar Disimpaction - Surgical- Distoangular
3rd molar Disimpaction - Surgical- Disto.description: Surgical removal of a horizontally impacted third molar (wisdom tooth) situated towards the back of the mouth.

3rd molar Disimpaction - Surgical-Horizo.name: 3rd molar Disimpaction - Surgical-Horizontal impaction
3rd molar Disimpaction - Surgical-Horizo.description: Surgical removal of horizontally impacted third molars (wisdom teeth) located towards the back of the mouth.

Indirect Sinus Lift plus Bone Graft char.name: Indirect Sinus Lift plus Bone Graft charges
Indirect Sinus Lift plus Bone Graft char.description: A procedure to augment bone volume in the upper jaw using a bone graft, usually accompanied by a sinus lift, to create a stable base for dental implants.

Direct sinus lift with graft.name: Direct sinus lift with graft
Direct sinus lift with graft.description: A surgical procedure to lift the sinus membrane and place a bone graft in the upper jaw to support dental implants.

Ridge augmentation.name: Ridge augmentation
Ridge augmentation.description: A surgical procedure to build up the height and width of the jawbone, often necessary for successful implant placement or aesthetic improvements.

Frenectomy/Minor oral surgery procedures.name: Frenectomy/Minor oral surgery procedures
Frenectomy/Minor oral surgery procedures.description: Surgical removal of a frenulum, a fold of tissue that restricts movement, commonly performed on the tongue or lips to correct speech or movement issues.

Cyst enucleation.name: Cyst enucleation
Cyst enucleation.description: Surgical removal of a cyst-like sac within the jawbone to prevent further growth and potential damage to surrounding structures.

Surgical canine exposure- Buccal.name: Surgical canine exposure- Buccal
Surgical canine exposure- Buccal.description: A surgical procedure to expose an impacted canine tooth, facilitating orthodontic alignment.

Surgical canine exposure- Palatal.name: Surgical canine exposure- Palatal
Surgical canine exposure- Palatal.description: A surgical procedure to expose an impacted canine tooth from the palate (roof of the mouth) to enable orthodontic treatment.

Alveoplasty.name: Alveoplasty
Alveoplasty.description: Surgical reshaping and smoothing of the jawbone following tooth extraction to prepare for dentures or improve healing.

Operculectomy.name: Operculectomy
Operculectomy.description: The surgical removal of the gum tissue covering a partially erupted tooth to prevent inflammation and infection.

Incisional Biopsy- excluding lab cost.name: Incisional Biopsy- excluding lab cost
Incisional Biopsy- excluding lab cost.description: A surgical procedure to remove a small sample of tissue for examination to diagnose oral lesions or abnormalities.

Excisional Biopsy- excluding lab cost.name: Excisional Biopsy- excluding lab cost
Excisional Biopsy- excluding lab cost.description: A surgical procedure to completely remove a suspicious oral lesion or abnormal tissue for diagnostic purposes.

Socket preservation.name: Socket preservation
Socket preservation.description: The placement of bone graft material in a tooth extraction socket to preserve bone volume for future implant placement.

OSMF (Limited Mouth Opening) - Through I.name: OSMF (Limited Mouth Opening) - Through Injectable Hydrocortisone or surgical
OSMF (Limited Mouth Opening) - Through I.description: Treatment for Oral Submucous Fibrosis, either with injectable hydrocortisone or surgical intervention to improve mouth opening.

Implant +PFM crown.name: Implant +PFM crown
Implant +PFM crown.description: Placement of a dental implant followed by a porcelain-fused-to-metal crown for durability and aesthetics.

Implant +Zirconia crown.name: Implant +Zirconia crown
Implant +Zirconia crown.description: Placement of a dental implant followed by a zirconia crown for excellent aesthetics and strength.

Implant crown - PFM (5yrs warranty).name: Implant crown - PFM (5yrs warranty)
Implant crown - PFM (5yrs warranty).description: A porcelain-fused-to-metal crown placed on a dental implant, typically covered by a 5-year warranty.

Implant crown - Zirconia (10yrs warranty.name: Implant crown - Zirconia (10yrs warranty)
Implant crown - Zirconia (10yrs warranty.description: A zirconia crown placed on a dental implant, usually with a 10-year warranty.

Implant - single.name: Implant - single
Implant - single.description: Placement of a single dental implant to replace a missing tooth.

Single arch - Full(PFM/Zirconia).name: Single arch - Full(PFM/Zirconia)
Single arch - Full(PFM/Zirconia).description: Full set of porcelain-fused-to-metal or zirconia crowns on one dental arch.

Double arch - Full(PFM/Zirconia).name: Double arch - Full(PFM/Zirconia)
Double arch - Full(PFM/Zirconia).description: Full set of porcelain-fused-to-metal or zirconia crowns on both dental arches.

Implant supported overdenture - Ball att.name: Implant supported overdenture - Ball attachment (4 implant)
Implant supported overdenture - Ball att.description: A removable denture secured by ball attachments on four dental implants.

Implant supported overdenture - Bar atta.name: Implant supported overdenture - Bar attachment (6 implant )
Implant supported overdenture - Bar atta.description: A removable denture anchored by a metal bar connected to six dental implants.

Implant supported overdenture - (5 impla.name: Implant supported overdenture - (5 implants)
Implant supported overdenture - (5 impla.description: A removable denture attached to five dental implants for enhanced stability.

Implant supported overdenture - single a.name: Implant supported overdenture - single arch (2 implants)
Implant supported overdenture - single a.description: A removable denture supported by two dental implants on a single arch.

Implant supported overdenture - single a.name: Implant supported overdenture - single arch (3 implants)
Implant supported overdenture - single a.description: A removable denture supported by three dental implants on a single arch.

Smiles.ai Aligners Hybrid- Metal.name: Smiles.ai Aligners Hybrid- Metal
Smiles.ai Aligners Hybrid- Metal.description: Hybrid aligners combining traditional and clear aligner therapy, using metal attachments for tooth movement.

Smiles.ai Aligners Hybrid- Ceramic.name: Smiles.ai Aligners Hybrid- Ceramic
Smiles.ai Aligners Hybrid- Ceramic.description: Hybrid aligners combining traditional and clear aligner therapy, using ceramic attachments for tooth movement.

Smiles.ai Aligners Hybrid- Self ligation.name: Smiles.ai Aligners Hybrid- Self ligation metral
Smiles.ai Aligners Hybrid- Self ligation.description: Hybrid aligners combining traditional and self-ligating brackets for orthodontic treatment.

Indirect Sinus Lift /quadrant.name: Indirect Sinus Lift /quadrant
Indirect Sinus Lift /quadrant.description: Augmenting bone in a specific quadrant of the upper jaw using a bone graft, commonly combined with a sinus lift for dental implant placement.

Bone graft - sinus lift (add on)/quadran.name: Bone graft - sinus lift (add on)/quadrant
Bone graft - sinus lift (add on)/quadran.description: Adding bone graft material during a sinus lift procedure in a specific quadrant of the upper jaw.

Direct sinus lift /Quadrant.name: Direct sinus lift /Quadrant
Direct sinus lift /Quadrant.description: A surgical procedure to lift the sinus membrane and place a bone graft in a specific quadrant of the upper jaw to support dental implants.

Trauma - IMF.name: Trauma - IMF
Trauma - IMF.description: Intermaxillary fixation used to immobilize and stabilize the jaw after a traumatic injury or surgery.

Laser -RCT (add on).name: Laser -RCT (add on)
Laser -RCT (add on).description: The use of laser technology as an adjunct to root canal treatment for improved disinfection and healing.

Laser - Currettage (add on ) Maxilla.name: Laser - Currettage (add on ) Maxilla
Laser - Currettage (add on ) Maxilla.description: Utilizing laser technology to assist in the currettage procedure, which involves removing infected tissue from the maxillary region.

Laser - Currettage (add on ) Mandible.name: Laser - Currettage (add on ) Mandible
Laser - Currettage (add on ) Mandible.description: Utilizing laser technology to assist in the currettage procedure, which involves removing infected tissue from the mandibular region.

Laser assisted minor surgey (add on).name: Laser assisted minor surgey (add on)
Laser assisted minor surgey (add on).description: Utilizing laser technology to assist in minor oral surgical procedures for improved precision and reduced healing time.

Orthodontic follow up -per appointment.name: Orthodontic follow up -per appointment
Orthodontic follow up -per appointment.description: Regular follow-up appointments during orthodontic treatment to assess progress and make necessary adjustments.

Canine disimpaction - Buccal.name: Canine disimpaction - Buccal
Canine disimpaction - Buccal.description: Surgical exposure and alignment of impacted canine teeth from the buccal (cheek) side.

Canine disimpaction-Palatal.name: Canine disimpaction-Palatal
Canine disimpaction-Palatal.description: Surgical exposure and alignment of impacted canine teeth from the palatal (roof of the mouth) side.

aligner.name: aligner
aligner.description: Aligners are transparent, removable trays that gradually straighten teeth without braces. They provide a discreet and convenient orthodontic treatment option.

implant.name: implant
implant.description: Dental implants are titanium posts surgically inserted into the jawbone to support artificial teeth, providing a durable and natural-looking solution for missing teeth.

brace.name: braces
brace.description: Braces are orthodontic devices consisting of metal or ceramic brackets bonded to teeth, connected by wires to correct misalignment and achieve straighter smiles.
